member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_SCRIPT
member.summary: The logon script executed. This value must be set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_ACCOUNTDISABLE
member.summary: The user's account is disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_HOMEDIR_REQUIRED
member.summary: The home directory is required. This value is ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_PASSWD_NOTREQD
member.summary: No password is required.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_PASSWD_CANT_CHANGE
member.summary: The user cannot change the password.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_LOCKOUT
member.summary: The account is currently locked out. You can call the NetUserSetInfo function to clear this value and unlock a previously locked account. You cannot use this value to lock a previously unlocked account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_DONT_EXPIRE_PASSWD
member.summary: The password should never expire on the account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_ENCRYPTED_TEXT_PASSWORD_ALLOWED
member.summary: The user's password is stored under reversible encryption in the Active Directory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_NOT_DELEGATED
member.summary: Marks the account as "sensitive"; other users cannot act as delegates of this user account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_SMARTCARD_REQUIRED
member.summary: Requires the user to log on to the user account with a smart card.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_USE_DES_KEY_ONLY
member.summary: Restrict this principal to use only Data Encryption Standard (DES) encryption types for keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH
member.summary: This account does not require Kerberos preauthentication for logon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_TRUSTED_FOR_DELEGATION
member.summary: The account is enabled for delegation. This is a security-sensitive setting; accounts with this option enabled should be tightly controlled. This setting allows a service running under the account to assume a client's identity and authenticate as that user to other remote servers on the network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_PASSWORD_EXPIRED
member.summary: The user's password has expired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_TRUSTED_TO_AUTHENTICATE_FOR_DELEGATION
member.summary: The account is trusted to authenticate a user outside of the Kerberos security package and delegate that user through constrained delegation. This is a security-sensitive setting; accounts with this option enabled should be tightly controlled. This setting allows a service running under the account to assert a client's identity and authenticate as that user to specifically configured services on the network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_MNS_LOGON_ACCOUNT
member.summary: This bit is ignored by clients and servers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_NO_AUTH_DATA_REQUIRED
member.summary: This bit is used by the Kerberos protocol. It indicates that when the key distribution center (KDC) is issuing a service ticket for this account, the privilege attribute certificate (PAC) is not to be included.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_PARTIAL_SECRETS_ACCOUNT

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_USE_AES_KEYS
member.summary: This bit is ignored by clients and servers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_NORMAL_ACCOUNT
member.summary: This is a default account type that represents a typical user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_TEMP_DUPLICATE_ACCOUNT
member.summary: This is an account for users whose primary account is in another domain. This account provides user access to this domain, but not to any domain that trusts this domain. The User Manager refers to this account type as a local user account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_WORKSTATION_TRUST_ACCOUNT
member.summary: This is a computer account for a computer that is a member of this domain.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_SERVER_TRUST_ACCOUNT
member.summary: This is a computer account for a backup domain controller that is a member of this domain.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.USER_FLAGS.UF_INTERDOMAIN_TRUST_ACCOUNT
member.summary: This is a permit to trust account for a domain that trusts other domains.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.DsGetDcName(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.GUID,System.String,Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.DSGETDCNAME_FLAGS,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Returns the name of a domain controller in a specified domain. This function accepts additional domain controller selection criteria to indicate preference for a domain controller with particular characteristics.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the server to process this function. Typically, this parameter is null, which indicates that the local computer is used.

Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the domain or application partition to query. This name can either be a DNS style name, for example, fabrikam.com, or a flat-style name, for example, Fabrikam. If a DNS style name is specified, the name may be specified with or without a trailing period.

Pointer to a GUID structure that specifies the GUID of the domain queried. If is not null and the domain specified by or cannot be found, attempts to locate a domain controller in the domain having the GUID specified by .

Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the site where the returned domain controller should physically exist. If this parameter is null, attempts to return a domain controller in the site closest to the site of the computer specified by . This parameter should be null by default.
Contains a set of flags that provide additional data used to process the request.
Pointer to a value that receives a pointer to a structure that contains data about the domain controller selected.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.GetSidSubAuthority(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns a pointer to a specified subauthority in a security identifier (SID). The subauthority value is a relative identifier (RID).
member.param: A pointer to the SID structure from which a pointer to a subauthority is to be returned.

Specifies an index value identifying the subauthority array element whose address the function will return. The function performs no validation tests on this value. An application can call the GetSidSubAuthorityCount function to discover the range of acceptable values.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the specified SID subauthority.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Netapi32NativeMethods.GetSidSubAuthorityCount(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the member in a security identifier (SID) structure that contains the subauthority count.
member.param: A pointer to the SID structure from which a pointer to the subauthority count is returned.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the subauthority count for the specified SID structure.

member.summary: Allocates a block of task memory in the same way that does.
member.param: This parameter must be 1
member.returns: An representing the OLE task memory allocator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Ole32NativeMethods.CoTaskMemAlloc(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the default OLE task memory allocator so applications can call its methods to manage memory.
member.param: The size of the memory block to be allocated, in bytes.
member.returns: The allocated memory block, if successful; otherwise, null.

remarks.para: uses the default allocator to allocate a memory block in the same way that does. It is not necessary to call the function before calling .

The initial contents of the returned memory block are undefined there is no guarantee that the block has been initialized. The allocated block may be larger than bytes because of the space required for alignment and for maintenance information.

If is 0, allocates a zero-length item and returns a valid pointer to that item. If there is insufficient memory available, returns null. Applications should always check the return value from this function, even when requesting small amounts of memory, because there is no guarantee that the memory will be allocated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Ole32NativeMethods.CoTaskMemFree(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees a block of task memory previously allocated through a call to the or function.
member.param: A pointer to the memory block to be freed.

remarks.para: The function uses the default OLE allocator.
The number of bytes freed equals the number of bytes that were originally allocated or reallocated. After the call, the memory block pointed to by is invalid and can no longer be used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Ole32NativeMethods.CoTaskMemRealloc(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes the size of a previously allocated block of task memory.
member.param: A pointer to the memory block to be reallocated.
The size of the memory block to be reallocated, in bytes.
member.returns: The allocated memory block, if successful; otherwise, null.

remarks.para: This function changes the size of a previously allocated memory block in the same way that does. It is not necessary to call the function to get a pointer to the OLE allocator before calling .

The parameter points to the beginning of the memory block. If is null, allocates a new memory block in the same way as the function. If is not null, it should be a pointer returned by a prior call to or .

The parameter specifies the size of the new block. The contents of the block are unchanged up to the shorter of the new and old sizes, although the new block can be in a different location. Because the new block can be in a different memory location, the pointer returned by is not guaranteed to be the pointer passed through the argument. If is not null and is 0, then the memory pointed to by is freed.

returns a void pointer to the reallocated (and possibly moved) memory block. The return value is null if the size is 0 and the buffer argument is not null, or if there is not enough memory available to expand the block to the specified size. In the first case, the original block is freed; in the second case, the original block is unchanged.

The storage space pointed to by the return value is guaranteed to be suitably aligned for storage of any type of object. To get a pointer to a type other than void, use a type cast on the return value.

member.name: T:System.Collections.Specialized.ExpressionCollection
member.summary: A collection of expressions that are resolved into strongly-typed values upon access.

remarks.para: An is a collection of internally-consistent C# expressions, keyed by name, that can be accessed and modified dynamically at runtime.

Expressions can be added either as expression strings via the property or as actual object references via the standard methods and properties. Expression strings can access other expressions by name, including other expression strings or object references that were added before the current expression.

member.name: P:System.Collections.Specialized.ExpressionCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of expressions contained in the .

member.name: P:System.Collections.Specialized.ExpressionCollection.Expressions
member.summary: Gets a dictionary containing the expressions contained in the as well as their values.

remarks.para: Expressions added to the property will be dynamically resolved upon accessing data from the . Expressions can reference other expressions by name. Nested expressions names can be indicated either in undecorated form (x) or with a variable decorator ($(x)).

Expressions are evaluated in the order in which they are added to the . Thus, in order to use a nested expression, any dependent expressions must be added before the depending expression. For example, in order to use an expression like a + b, both a and b must be present in the .

Adding expressions via the property differs from adding expressions directly to the in the following way: expressions added to the directly are stored via an object reference to a standard, in-memory object. As such, they are subject to all normal reference- and value-type rules, depending on the type. Furthermore, they cannot contain references to any dynamic expressions. Expressions added via the property, on the other hand, are evaluated dynamically each time data is accessed. As such, they will dynamically update as the value of other expressions in the collection change.

member.name: P:System.Collections.Specialized.ExpressionCollection.Keys
member.summary: Gets an containing the keys of the .

member.name: P:System.Collections.Specialized.ExpressionCollection.Values
member.summary: Gets an containing the values in the .

member.summary: Gets or the value of the expression with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the expression to get.
member.returns: The value of the expression with the specified key.

remarks.para: When accessing an expression's value using the getter, string expressions are evaluated using the current state of the . Subsequent accesses to the same expression may result in different values if the state of the variables in the have changed.
When using the setter, expressions are added using a direct object reference to .

Adding expressions via the method differs from adding expressions via the property in the following way: expressions added to the directly are stored via an object reference to a standard, in-memory object. As such, they are subject to all normal reference- and value-type rules, depending on the type. Furthermore, they cannot contain references to any dynamic expressions. Expressions added via the property, on the other hand, are evaluated dynamically each time data is accessed. As such, they will dynamically update as the value of other expressions in the collection change.

member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.Specialized.CounterLruFixedCapacityCollection`2
member.summary: Represents a collection of keys and values that has a maximum size which is enforced via "Least Recently Used" (LRU) caching algorithm and that additionally expires elements that pass a specified staleness threshold.
member.typeparam: The type of the keys in the cache.
The type of the values in the cache.

remarks.para: The is a specialized subclass of the generic class. In addition to the normal functionality provided by , the maintains a counter for each element added to the collection that is updated whenever an element is accessed. When performing size enforcing, any element that is older than the specified staleness window will be automatically removed.

Staleness enforcement is applied after any operation that changes the collection in any way, including reading a value (but not checking for the existence of a key in the collection). As a consequence, most of the methods that were O(1) in are now O(n) in the worst case, where n is equal to (in the best case, they are still O(1)).

The efficiency of this class depends highly on how aggressive the staleness check is. If you are going to make a series of changes to the collection in quick sequence, it is often a good idea to call and around the updates to reduce the number of times constraints are enforced.
Unless otherwise mentioned, the class behaves identically to a with the same type parameters.

member.name: P:System.Collections.Generic.Specialized.CounterLruFixedCapacityCollection`2.KeyStaleness
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how long keys are persisted in the collection before automatically expiring.

remarks.para: Decreasing the staleness threshold will result in immediate removal of items over the new staleness threshold. Increasing the threshold has no immediate impact on the state of the collection.

Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation. Increasing the threshold is an O(1) operation. Decreasing the threshold is an O(n) operation, where n is the number of elements that need to be removed as a result of the decreased threshold.

If type implements the generic interface, the default equality comparer uses that implementation. member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.Specialized.HashMap`1
member.summary: A collection of objects keyed by hash codes and optimized for performance.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the map.

remarks.para: The class is a specialized collection similar to a that focuses on performance. The API is designed in such a way that the map can be queried in a very efficient manner without excessive recomputation of an object's hash and without storing a separate object to represent each element's key. As such, it does not contain many of the methods of a standard collection, nor does it implement .

Although this class is called , many of the methods on the class interact with the underlying data via index rather than key. Hashing is still a fundamental concept in the underlying storage, and interacting with the shares many characteristics with other hash-based structures like and ; however, for the most part, the actual computation of the hash code is done outside the .

The has no concept of equality - it is possible to insert the same item more than once with the same hash code. If is a reference type, null values can be stored in the by using the or overloads and supplying a hash code.

remarks.para: The capacity of a is the number of elements that the can store. The property is the number of elements that are actually in the .

is always greater than or equal to . If exceeds the capacity while adding elements, the implementer must remove an item before adding the new elements. It is up to the implementer to decide which item to remove.

Decreasing the capacity will result in immediate removal of items over the new capacity according to the standard removal algorithm. Increasing the capacity has no immediate impact on the state of the collection.

member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.LruFixedCapacityCollection`2
member.summary: Represents a collection of keys and values that has a maximum size which is enforced via "Least Recently Used" (LRU) caching algorithm.
member.typeparam: The type of the keys in the cache.
The type of the values in the cache.

remarks.para: The generic class provides a mapping from a set of keys to a set of values, much like a . It also maintains a fixed capacity that determines the maximum number of elements that can exist in the collection at once. When adding an item would result in the cache going over capacity, the item that was least-recently accessed will be removed to make room for the new item.

Adding, removing, and retrieving items from a are all close to O(1) operations, with similar performance characteristics to the same operations in a (specifically, the quality of the hashing algorithm determines retrieval performance).

This class is not currently thread-safe, as even reading the collection results in structural changes to the underlying data. To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading or writing, you must implement your own synchronization.
Unless otherwise mentioned, the class behaves identically to a with the same type parameters.

member.name: P:System.Collections.Generic.LruFixedCapacityCollection`2.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum capacity of the cache.

remarks.para: The capacity of a is the number of elements that the can store. The property is the number of elements that are actually in the .
is always greater than or equal to . If exceeds the capacity while adding elements, the least-recently accessed item is automatically removed before adding the new elements.

Decreasing the capacity will result in immediate removal of items over the new capacity according to the standard removal algorithm. Increasing the capacity has no immediate impact on the state of the collection.

Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation. Increasing the capacity is an O(1) operation. Decreasing the capacity is an O(n) operation, where n is the number of elements that need to be removed as a result of the decreased capacity.

member.name: P:System.Collections.Generic.LruFixedCapacityCollection`2.Item(`0)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get or set.
member.returns: The value of the element with the specified key.
member.exception: The property is retrieved and does not exist in the collection.

remarks.para: This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following C# syntax: myCollection[key].

You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the . When you set the property value, if the key is in the , the value associated with that key is replaced by the assigned value. If the key is not in the , the key and value are added to the cache. In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements.
A key cannot be null, but a value can be, if the value type TValue is a reference type.

When getting or setting the value of this property, if the contains an element with the specified key, the element's last access time is updated, making it less likely to be automatically removed when adding elements to a full cache.
Getting or setting the value of this property approaches an O(1) operation.

member.param: The key of the element to add.
The value of the element to add. The value can be null for reference types.
member.exception: An element with the same key already exists in the

remarks.para: You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in ; for example, myCollection[myKey] = myValue. However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. In contrast, the method throws an exception if a value with the specified key already exists.
If the value already equals the capacity, the least-recently accessed item in the is removed before the new element is added.
If the contains an element with the specified key, the element's last access time is not updated by this operation.
A key cannot be null, but a value can be, if is a reference type.
Whether is less than or the same as the capacity, this method approaches an O(1) operation.

remarks.para: This method combines the functionality of the method and the property.
If the key is not found, then the parameter gets the appropriate default value for the type ; for example, 0 (zero) for integer types, false for boolean types, and null for reference types.
Use the method if your code frequently attempts to access keys that are not in the cache. Using this method is more efficient than catching the thrown by the property.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.LruFixedCapacityCollection`2.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .
member.returns: A structure for the .

remarks.para: For purposes of enumeration, each item is a structure representing a value and its key.

The enumerator returned by this method remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined.

The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization.
Enumerating through elements in the cache in this way will access each element as it is enumerated.
This method is an O(1) operation.

member.remarks: This enumerator iterates over items in an undefined order. TODO - should it be access order? Reverse access order? Either of these requires a lookup for each iteration, which is a bit more expensive than just linearly iterating.

member.name: T:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories
member.summary: Defines the Unicode category of a character.
member.remarks: This enumeration is similar to . However, unlike , these categories are flags and can be combined together. This enumeration contains several meta values, such as , , and , which encapsulate several individual categories.

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Letter
member.summary: Letter character. Signified by the Unicode designations "Lu" (letter, uppercase), "Ll" (letter, lowercase), "Lt" (letter, titlecase), "Lm" (letter, modifier), and "Lo" (letter, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to , , , , and .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.UppercaseLetter
member.summary: Uppercase letter. Signified by the Unicode designation "Lu" (letter, uppercase).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.LowercaseLetter
member.summary: Lowercase letter. Signified by the Unicode designation "Ll" (letter, lowercase).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.TitlecaseLetter
member.summary: Titlecase letter. Signified by the Unicode designation "Lu" (letter, titlecase).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.ModifierLetter
member.summary: Modifier letter character, which is free-standing spacing character that indicates modifications of a preceding letter. Signified by the Unicode designation "Lm" (letter, modifier).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OtherLetter
member.summary: Letter that is not an uppercase letter, a lowercase letter, a titlecase letter, or a modifier letter. Signified by the Unicode designation "Lo" (letter, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Mark
member.summary: Mark character. Signified by the Unicode designations "Mc" (mark, spacing combining), "Me" (mark, enclosing), "Mn" (mark, nonspacing), and "Mo" (mark, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to , , and . has no corresponding value for OtherMark.

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.SpacingCombiningMark
member.summary: Spacing character that indicates modifications of a base character and affects the width of the glyph for that base character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Mc" (mark, spacing combining).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.EnclosingMark
member.summary: Enclosing mark character, which is a nonspacing combining character that surrounds all previous characters up to and including a base character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Me" (mark, enclosing).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.NonSpacingMark
member.summary: Nonspacing character that indicates modifications of a base character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Mn" (mark, nonspacing).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OtherMark
member.summary: Mark that is not a spacing combining mark, an enclosing mark, or a nonspacing mark. Signified by the Unicode designation "Mo" (mark, other).
member.remarks: Has no corresponding value in .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Number
member.summary: Number character. Signified by the Unicode designations "Nd" (number, decimal), "Nl" (number, letter), and "No" (number, other).
member.remarks: Correponds to , , and .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.DecimalDigitNumber
member.summary: Decimal digit character, that is, a character in the range 0 through 9. Signified by the Unicode designation "Nd" (number, decimal digit).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.LetterNumber
member.summary: Number represented by a letter, instead of a decimal digit, for example, the Roman numeral for five, which is "V". The indicator is signified by the Unicode designation "Nl" (number, letter).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OtherNumber
member.summary: Number that is neither a decimal digit nor a letter number, for example, the fraction 1/2. The indicator is signified by the Unicode designation "No" (number, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Punctuation
member.summary: Punctuation character. Signified by the Unicode designations "Pc" (punctuation, connector), "Pd" (punctuation, dash), "Ps" (punctuation, open), "Pe" (punctuation, close), "Pi" (punctuation, initial), "Pf" (punctuation, final), and "Po" (punctuation, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to , , , , , , and .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.ConnectorPunctuation
member.summary: Connector punctuation character that connects two characters. Signified by the Unicode designation "Pc" (punctuation, connector).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.DashPunctuation
member.summary: Dash or hyphen character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Pd" (punctuation, dash).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OpenPunctuation
member.summary: Opening character of one of the paired punctuation marks, such as parentheses, square brackets, and braces. Signified by the Unicode designation "Ps" (punctuation, open).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.ClosePunctuation
member.summary: Closing character of one of the paired punctuation marks, such as parentheses, square brackets, and braces. Signified by the Unicode designation "Pe" (punctuation, close).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.InitialQuotePunctuation
member.summary: Opening or initial quotation mark character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Pi" (punctuation, initial quote).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.FinalQuotePunctuation
member.summary: Closing or final quotation mark character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Pf" (punctuation, final quote).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OtherPunctuation
member.summary: Punctuation character that is not a connector, a dash, open punctuation, close punctuation, an initial quote, or a final quote. Signified by the Unicode designation "Po" (punctuation, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Symbol
member.summary: Symbol character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Sc" (symbol, currency), "Sk" (symbol, modifier), "Sm" (symbol, math), and "So"(symbol, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to , , , and .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.CurrencySymbol
member.summary: Currency symbol character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Sc" (symbol, currency).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.ModifierSymbol
member.summary: Modifier symbol character, which indicates modifications of surrounding characters. For example, the fraction slash indicates that the number to the left is the numerator and the number to the right is the denominator. The indicator is signified by the Unicode designation "Sk" (symbol, modifier).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.MathSymbol
member.summary: Mathematical symbol character, such as "+" or "= ". Signified by the Unicode designation "Sm" (symbol, math).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OtherSymbol
member.summary: Symbol character that is not a mathematical symbol, a currency symbol or a modifier symbol. Signified by the Unicode designation "So" (symbol, other).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Separator
member.summary: Separator character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Zs" (separator, space), "Zl" (separator, line), and "Zp" (separator, paragraph).
member.remarks: Corresponds to , , and .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.SpaceSeparator
member.summary: Space character, which has no glyph but is not a control or format character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Zs" (separator, space).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.LineSeparator
member.summary: Character that is used to separate lines of text. Signified by the Unicode designation "Zl" (separator, line).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.ParagraphSeparator
member.summary: Character used to separate paragraphs. Signified by the Unicode designation "Zp" (separator, paragraph).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Other
member.summary: Other character. Signified by the Unicode designation "Cc" (other, control), "Cf" (other, format), "Co" (other, private use), "Cs" (other, surrogate), and "Cn" (other, not assigned).
member.remarks: Corresponds to , , , , and .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Control
member.summary: Control code character, with a Unicode value of U+007F or in the range U+0000 through U+001F or U+0080 through U+009F. Signified by the Unicode designation "Cc" (other, control).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Format
member.summary: Format character that affects the layout of text or the operation of text processes, but is not normally rendered. Signified by the Unicode designation "Cf" (other, format).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.PrivateUse
member.summary: Private-use character, with a Unicode value in the range U+E000 through U+F8FF. Signified by the Unicode designation "Co" (other, private use).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.Surrogate
member.summary: High surrogate or a low surrogate character. Surrogate code values are in the range U+D800 through U+DFFF. Signified by the Unicode designation "Cs" (other, surrogate).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: F:System.Globalization.UnicodeCategories.OtherNotAssigned
member.summary: Character that is not assigned to any Unicode category. Signified by the Unicode designation "Cn" (other, not assigned).
member.remarks: Corresponds to .

member.name: T:System.IUpdatable
member.summary: Provides methods for temporarily disabling expensive operations during a period of frequent changes.

remarks.para: The interface represents the pattern often seen in UI applications where operations need to be performed on a UI element without redrawing in between each change. This pattern can be extended to any sort of operation where expensive computations can be postponed while making frequent state changes to the underlying object until all changes have been completed.

member.name: P:System.IUpdatable.IsUpdating
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is currently in an updating state.

remarks.para: This property should be set to true by and set to false by .
If nested updates are supported, this property should be true until all updates have been ended, at which point it should be set back to false.

member.name: M:System.IUpdatable.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Begins an update operation, disabling any per-change operations.

remarks.para: This method should be called prior to any series of operations that would result in multiple redundant computations. These computations will be postponed until is called.
The implementer may choose to allow or disallow nested calls to and . However, these methods must alway be called in pairs.
If nested updating is not supported, then calling this method when the object is already updating should throw a .

member.name: M:System.IUpdatable.EndUpdate
member.summary: Ends an update operation, re-enabling per-change operations and optionally updating state to reflect any changes that occurred during the update operation.

remarks.para: This method should be called after update operations have finished. Optionally, any pending computations may be performed at this time.
The implementer may choose to allow or disallow nested calls to and . However, these methods must alway be called in pairs.

member.name: M:System.Reflection.FieldOrPropertyInfo.GetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the value of a member supported by a given object.
member.param: The object whose member value will be returned.
member.returns: An object containing the value reflected by this instance.

remarks.para: If the member is static, is ignored. For non-static fields, should be an instance of a class that inherits or declares the member. Note that the return type of is . For example, if the field holds a primitive value, an instance of with the appropriate value is returned. Before returning the value, checks to see if the user has access permission.
This method can be used to access a property that does not have indexed values. It will not work if the property in question required indexes.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldOrPropertyInfo.IsInitOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the member can only be set in the body of the constructor.

remarks.para: If the returned value is true, the member can only be initialized, and is read-only thereafter.
The property is set when the attribute is set. It is always false for properties.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldOrPropertyInfo.IsLiteral
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the value is written at compile time and cannot be changed.

remarks.para: If the returned value is true, the member cannot be changed and is constant.
The property is set when the attribute is set. It is always false for properties.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldOrPropertyInfo.IsSpecialName
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the corresponding attribute is set in the enumerator.

remarks.para: Names that begin with or contain an underscore character (_), property accessors, and operator overloading methods are examples of names that might require special treatment by some compilers.

member.name: P:System.Reflection.FieldOrPropertyInfo.IsStatic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the member is static.

remarks.para: When a field is static, one copy of the field is shared by all instances of the type.
The property is set when the attribute is set (for fields), or when one of the property setter or getter methods is static (for properties).

member.param: The object whose member value will be set.

remarks.para: This method will assign to the member reflected by this instance on object . If the member is static, will be ignored. For non-static members, should be an instance of a class that inherits or declares the member. The new value is passed as an . For example, if the member's type is , an instance of with the appropriate value is passed. Before setting the value, checks to see if the user has access permission.

member.summary: This class reads characters from a single string as required, for example, by Visual Studio language services

member.name: M:QUT.GplexBuffers.BuildBuffer.Mark
member.summary: Marks a conservative lower bound for the buffer, allowing space to be reclaimed. If an application needs to call GetString at arbitrary past locations in the input stream, Mark() is not called.

member.name: M:QUT.GplexBuffers.BuildBuffer.Read
member.summary: Read returns the ordinal number of the next char, or EOF (-1) for an end of stream. Note that the next code point may require *two* calls of Read().

member.name: T:QUT.GplexBuffers.Guesser
member.summary: This class provides a simple finite state automaton that scans the file looking for (1) valid UTF-8 byte patterns, (2) bytes >= 0x80 which are not part of a UTF-8 sequence. The method then guesses whether it is UTF-8 or maybe some local machine default encoding. This works well for the various Latin encodings.

member.name: T:QUT.Gppg.IMerge`1
member.summary: Classes implementing this interface must supply a method that merges two location objects to return a new object of the same type. GPPG-generated parsers have the default location action equivalent to "@$ = @1.Merge(@N);" where N is the right-hand-side length of the production.
member.typeparam: The Location type

member.name: M:QUT.Gppg.IMerge`1.Merge(`0)
member.summary: Interface method that creates a location object from the current and last object. Typically used to create a location object extending from the start of the @1 object to the end of the @N object.
member.param: The lexically last object to merge
member.returns: The merged location object
